comments:
Just installed a fresh 3.2RC3 Eclipse and a fresh workspace a simple "Check out" from CVS fails.

Line 93 in ResponseHandler reads:

            IResource resource = folder.getIResource();
            if (resource != null && resource.getProject().isAccessible() && !CVSTeamProvider.isSharedWithCVS(resource.getProject())) {

...maybe, some more NPE checks are needed here.

Expert from the .log file:

I suspect your server has TopLevelAdmin=true in your CVSROOT/config file. Can you confirm this? The fix ill be simple and shold be included in RC4.

True.

The CVSROO/config file says: TopLevelAdmin=yes

Cheers,
Christian

This bug makes checkout impossible for a particular server configuration. This is a regression and the fix is trivial. McQ and Jeff, can I get your approval for this. I can give a demo, if either of you would like.

Created an attachment (id=40989)
Safer patch

The previous patch, although correct, was not as provably safe as this new patch.

+1

I inspected the code that is about to be released and it is safe in that all it does is check for null.  If the null case never happens (it does), then the new code isn't harmfull.  I checked the method to make sure the same failure couldn't happen later on.  MV, did you check all other references to the method to make sure the failure doesn't happen elsewhere?  I forgot until just now.

If you are asking if we always do a null check on the result of resource.getProject() then the answer is no. However, I have checked in in all the other cases I found related to the change that caused this particular problem, and it is not possible for those cases to be given a resource that does not have a project (i.e. getProject will never return null).
I see the extra protection code that was added. +1.
Ok, I suggest that you change all senders of getProject() to check for null AFTER 3.2 ships.

Verified ... in RC4, I can checkout all projects again.

Cheers,
Christian
